results.name: a(n)=(1/2)*Sum{|d(i)-e(i)|} where Sum{d(i)*2^i} is base 2 representation of n and e(i) are digits d(i) in reverse order.
comment: a(n) = least number of digits for which the change 0->1 in (binary n) yields a palindrome.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: a:= proc(n) local r, ad: r:= proc(s) options operator, arrow: [seq(s[nops(s)-j+1], j = 1 .. nops(s))] end proc: ad := proc(s) local i,j: j := 0: for i to nops(s) do if 0 < abs((s-r(s))[i]) then j := j+1 else end if end do: (1/2)*j end proc: ad(convert(n, base, 2)) end proc: seq(a(n), n = 1 .. 90); # _Emeric Deutsch_, Aug 20 2016
mathematica: a[n_] := (bits = IntegerDigits[n, 2]; Total[Abs[bits - Reverse[bits]]]/2); Table[a[n], {n, 1, 90}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 16 2013 *)
program: a037888 n = div (sum $ map abs $ zipWith (-) bs $ reverse bs) 2
